description.en:
A man and a woman who have something to protect, but are seduced by lust and fall in love. A collection short stories about men and women who awaken the forbidden love of infidelity.

Volume 1:
1- **Kawaita Kaze**「乾いた風」
2- **Amai Sasoi**「甘い誘い」
3- **Shiawase no Michi**「幸せの道」
4- **Dousoukai**「同窓会」
5- **Part no Yuuwaku**「パートの誘惑」
6-7. **Kokkyou wo Koeta Ai (Zengohen)**「国境を越えた愛」（前後編）
8- **Tsugou no Ii Onna**「都合のいい女」
9- **Orokana Otoko**「愚かな男」

Volume 2:
1- **Giri no Otouto**「義理の弟」
2- **Aru Kyapa Jou no Koi**「あるキャパ嬢の恋」
3- **Shojo no Daishou**「処女の代償」
4- **Koukou Kyoushi**「高校教師」
5- **Doyoubi no Ouse**「土曜日の逢瀬」
6- **Tabisaki no Ayamachi**「旅先の過ち」
7- **Dekiru Onna**「デキる女」
8- **Deai-kei**「出会い系」
9- **Surechigai no Koi**「すれ違いの恋」
description.es-la:
Un hombre y una mujer que tienen algo que proteger, pero se dejan seducir por la lujuria y se enamoran. Una colección de historias cortas sobre hombres y mujeres que despiertan el amor prohibido de la infidelidad.

Volumen 1:
1- **Kawaita Kaze**「乾いた風」
2- **Amai Sasoi**「甘い誘い」
3- **Shiawase no Michi**「幸せの道」
4- **Dousoukai**「同窓会」
5- **Part no Yuuwaku**「パートの誘惑」
6-7. **Kokkyou wo Koeta Ai (Zengohen)**「国境を越えた愛」（前後編）
8- **Tsugou no Ii Onna**「都合のいい女」
9- **Orokana Otoko**「愚かな男」

Volumen 2:
1- **Giri no Otouto**「義理の弟」
2- **Aru Kyapa Jou no Koi**「あるキャパ嬢の恋」
3- **Shojo no Daishou**「処女の代償」
4- **Koukou Kyoushi**「高校教師」
5- **Doyoubi no Ouse**「土曜日の逢瀬」
6- **Tabisaki no Ayamachi**「旅先の過ち」
7- **Dekiru Onna**「デキる女」
8- **Deai-kei**「出会い系」
9- **Surechigai no Koi**「すれ違いの恋」
description.ja:
護るべきものがありながら、欲望に魅入られ堕ちてゆく、男と女――。不倫という禁断の愛に目覚める男と女のストーリーを描いた全9編の短編集

1:
「乾いた風」不倫に陥った男女の、ペーソス（哀愁）溢れる短編集。他に「甘い誘い」「幸せの道」「同窓会」「パートの誘惑」「国境を越えた愛」（前後編）「都合のいい女」「愚かな男」を収録。
2:
「義理の弟」他に「あるキャパ嬢の恋」「処女の代償」「高校教師」「土曜日の逢瀬」「旅先の過ち」「デキる女」「出会い系」「すれ違いの恋」を収録。

biography.en:
Ryou Kurashina is a Japanese former comic artist and author who dropped out of Meiji University. Maakou and Jibiki Kazuya were once his assistants.

He specializes in stories about Mizu shoubai, euphemism for the night-time entertainment business (or, as he calls it, "Neon-gai mono"). He is a big name in this field, and is said to be the founder of Neon Gekiga.
He used to write gekiga under the name Tsukasa Kei (also written original manga under the name "Takashi Tsukasa"). In addition to writing original manga, he also runs the editorial production companies "Free Hand" and "Office Kei" under his real name, Keiji Ooba, and is contracted by publishers to produce entire magazines or parts of them.

In 1971, he made his debut as a manga artist under the name "Takashi Tsukasa". He worked mainly for youth magazines, and produced a number of hit works, mainly bunkara stories, and has created many long-selling works,(representative works include "Yabou no Mure," "Aizu Otoko Uta," "Takeda Miken Hoshi," and "Shouwa Baka Hayashi"). In particular, "Yabou no Mure" is famous as a super-long hit that ran for 28 volumes. More than 40 of his works have been published in tankobon form.

However, he gradually began to feel stalled as a comic book author, and decided to abandon writing. As a result, he changed his name to Ryo Kurashina and restarted his career as a full-time cartoonist. His first original work was the "Akujo no Kagami" series with Issaku Wake. Many of his original works are Neon Gekiga with female protagonists, and his representative works include "Jotei", "Jouou," and "Yaou", which were made into TV dramas. He also writes not only neon stories but also economic stories such as "DAWN" and "Zenibana", maiko stories such as "Jotei Hanamai" and "Hanna rito", and entertainment stories such as "Joyuu" and "Ai Ningyo".
